DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Sample RNA Integrity In Situ Hybridization Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the RNA integrity of the tumor sample, determined by in-situ hybridization analysis, when compared to the normal control.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Tissue Ribonucleic Acid Integrity In Situ Hybridization
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis._The state of being complete or undivided, of being sound or undamaged._Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredName: Ribonucleic Acid Integrity in situ Hybridization
Property.preferredDefinition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.:The state of being complete or undivided, of being sound or undamaged.:Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues

Concepts.definition: Single-stranded long chain of nucleotides containing ribose. It is the end product of DNA transcription by the enzyme RNA polymerase. It is essential in protein synthesis.
The state of being complete or undivided, of being sound or undamaged.
Use of a DNA or RNA probe to detect the presence of complementary sequences in chromosomes, cells, or tissues.
